hotspots.label: Water Feature Pond
hotspots.fact: This small pond in the garden provides a habitat for aquatic plants and animals. Water features help gardens stay cool and attract beneficial insects like dragonflies that eat mosquitoes!

hotspots.label: Pollinator Flowers
hotspots.fact: The bright yellow and purple flowers in this garden attract bees, butterflies, and other pollinators. These insects help flowers make seeds by moving pollen from flower to flower as they drink nectar.

hotspots.label: Ornamental Grasses
hotspots.fact: The tall, dark green grass-like plants add texture and movement to gardens. These plants need less water than flowers and provide shelter for small insects and birds.

hotspots.label: Layered Garden Design
hotspots.fact: This garden uses plants of different heights—tall plants in back, short flowers in front. This arrangement helps all plants get sunlight and creates a beautiful, healthy ecosystem.
